---
title: "Manipulate data"
---


## Introduction


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
library(reticulate)
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Paket 'reticulate' wurde unter R Version 4.1.3 erstellt
```
:::
:::




## Import data from files


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
library(RStata)
df1 <- RStata::stata("import excel ./data/dataset1.xlsx",
                     data.out = TRUE)
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
. import excel ./data/dataset1.xlsx
(5 vars, 151 obs)
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{python}}
import pandas as pd
df2 = pd.read_csv('./data/dataset1.csv')
```
````
:::

::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
library(haven)
df3 <- haven::read_dta("./data/dataset1.dta")
```
````
:::


::: {.panel-tabset}

#### Exercise 1

Can you indicate what variable has been modified in **dataset1** between df1 and df2?

::: callout-tip
Use the R function **comparedf**
:::


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
# Write your code here
```
````
:::


#### Solution


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
arsenal::comparedf(df1, py$df2)
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Compare Object

Function Call: 
arsenal::comparedf(x = df1, y = py$df2)

Shared: 0 non-by variables and 32 observations.
Not shared: 16 variables and 119 observations.

Differences found in 0/0 variables compared.
0 variables compared have non-identical attributes.
```
:::
:::


:::
